summary: 9b is known to localize in the extra-nuclear region and has been postulated to possess a nuclear export signal (NES), but the role of NES in 9b functioning is not well understood. we have also revealed that this NES activity influences the half-life of 9b and affects host cell death. the 9b protein is encoded by ORF-9b of the SARS-CoV genome. a nuclear export signal (NES) present in its 46-LRLGSQLSL-54 amino acid region has been suggested to be responsible for its nucleocytoplasmic export. the requirement for caspase 3 in apoptosis induction was further confirmed using the cell permeant caspase inhibitors. this is the first report associating 9b with nucleocytoplasmic export linked apoptosis. b were replaced by alanine (mu-NES-9bEGFPN1: 46-LRLGSQLSL-54 to 46-ARAGSQASA-54)
